page.title: 19IMPROVING EAST MERSEA
page.content: There is only one bus from East Mersea to Colchester in the morning and two services from Colchester in the late afternoon. In a survey of 55 householders 45% said a more frequent bus-service would improve their quality of life. Although the census revealed that 86% of households had access to a car, 48% had only one car. The problem is more acute for the elderly,some 19 households in the census, contained pensioners but had no car. The deteriorating transport provision in this rural area is producing a significant minority of isolated and lonely elderly people. Other improvements mentioned were more shops, better drainage, nearer health facilities and street lights. However a significant 18% of the survey stated that they were entirely satisfied and wanted no developments.
